paper_title.ja: A strongly Antiferromagnetically Coupled Dinickel(Ⅱ) Center Bridged by One Azido and One AIKOXO
paper_title.en: A strongly antiferromagnetically coupled dinickel(II) center bridged by one azido and one alkoxo

description.en: The dinuclear nickel(II) complexes [Ni-2(L-Et)(mu-1,3-N-3)-(N-3)(H2O)].[Ni-2(L-Et)(mu-1,3-N-3)(N-3)(CH3OH)](NO3)(2).H2O, (1) and [Ni-2(L-Et)(mu-1,3-N-3)(N-3)(H2O)]NO3.H2O, (1') (HL-Et= N, N, N', N'-tetrakis [(1-ethyl-2-benzimidazolyl)methyl]-2-hydroxy-1,3-diaminopropane) bridged by one alkoxo of L-Et- and one azido were prepared and the crystal structure of 1 was determined by X-ray crystallography. Magnetic susceptibility measurements for V from liquid helium temperature to room temperature showed an antiferromagnetically strong interaction (2J = - 187 cm(-1), H = - 2JS(1) . S-2).

paper_title.en: A strongly antiferromagnetically coupled dinickel(II) center bridged by one azido and one alkoxo

description.en: The dinuclear nickel(II) complexes [Ni-2(L-Et)(mu-1,3-N-3)-(N-3)(H2O)].[Ni-2(L-Et)(mu-1,3-N-3)(N-3)(CH3OH)](NO3)(2).H2O, (1) and [Ni-2(L-Et)(mu-1,3-N-3)(N-3)(H2O)]NO3.H2O, (1') (HL-Et= N, N, N', N'-tetrakis [(1-ethyl-2-benzimidazolyl)methyl]-2-hydroxy-1,3-diaminopropane) bridged by one alkoxo of L-Et- and one azido were prepared and the crystal structure of 1 was determined by X-ray crystallography. Magnetic susceptibility measurements for V from liquid helium temperature to room temperature showed an antiferromagnetically strong interaction (2J = - 187 cm(-1), H = - 2JS(1) . S-2).

paper_title.en: Synthesis and cyclic voltammetry of trinuclear [Pd-3(mu(3)-E)(2)(dpae)(3)](2+) clusters; E = S, Se or Te; dpae=1,2-bis(diphenylarsino)ethane and X-ray structure of [Pd-3(mu(3)-S)(2)(dpae)(3)][BPh4](2)

description.en: The trinuclear clusters [Pd-3(mu(3)-E)(2)(dpae)(3)][BPh4](2) (E=S (1), Se (2) or Te (3); dpae=1,2-bis(diphenylarsino)ethane) were synthesized and the crystal structure of [Pd-3(mu(3)-S)(2)(dpae)(3)][BPh4](2) 1 was determined by X-ray diffraction methods. The structure of [Pd-3(mu(3)-S)(2)(dpae)(3)](2+) comprises three square planar PdS2As2 coordination planes sharing two mu(3)-S2- ions. In the central trigonal bipyramidal Pd3S2 core the interatomic distances are Pd-S 2.337(mean) and S ... S 3.083(7) Angstrom; there are two shorter Pd ... Pd distances of 3.008(3) and 2.998(2) Angstrom and one longer Pd ... Pd distance of 3.117(3) Angstrom. The reduction process of 1, 2 and 3 has been studied by cyclic voltammetry. The clusters 2 and 3 are reversibly reduced and oxidized at the scan rate of 500 mV s(-1) and 100 mV s(-1), respectively at 255 K. The cluster 1 is not reduced reversibly at a scan rate of 500 mV s(-1) at 255 K, The ease of reduction and the extent of reversibility are in the order Te>Se>S for the [Pd-3(mu(3)-E)(2)(dpae)(3)][BPh4](2) clusters. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Syntheses, crystal structures and autoreduction behavior of antiferromagnetically coupled dicopper ((]G0002[)) oximato complexes
The Formation of a Hydrogencarbonato-bridged Dinuclear Copper ((]G0002[)) Complexes by Fixation and Activation of Atmospheric CO<sub>2</sub>
Redox active artificial ferrocenyl ellagitannins. Simple synthesis and their electrochemical properties

description.en: Synthesis of three types of novel redox active artificial ferrocenyl ellagitannins has been accomplished in just three steps, and their electrochemical properties have been investigated.

paper_title.en: Synthesis, structure and characterization of dinuclear nickel((]G0002[))complexes containing the derivatives of N, N, N', N'-tetrakis[(2-benzimidazolyl)methyl]-2-hydroxy-1,3-diaminoprpane and an acetate or a propionate ion
Syntheses, structures, and properties of the dinuclear copper(II) and nickel(II) complexes bridged by an alkoxide and a pyridazine or a phthalazine

description.en: In this paper we report our recent research on the dinuclear copper(II) and nickel(II) complexes 1-10 (Chart 1) containing Schiff bases, derived from acetylacetone, benzoylacetone, or trifluoroacetylacetone, and 1,3-diaminopropane-2-ol. These complexes are bridged by an alkoxide and a pyridazine (pyd) or phthalazine (phta). The magnetic susceptibilities, visible absorption spectra, conductivities, and redox properties of the complexes were investigated and the molecular structures of 2, 4, and 5 are described. The Cu-O-Cu angles found in these complexes indicate a role of the alkoxo-bridge as one of the principal antiferromagnetic exchange pathways. At the same time, the coplanarity of two coordination planes of copper(II) ions is also shown to relate to the exchange process.
